title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 16 September 2016 - XWiki
content: has quit 02:44  has quit 03:12  has quit 03:13  has joined #xwiki 06:14  has joined #xwiki 07:04  has joined #xwiki 07:04  has joined #xwiki 07:26  has joined #xwiki 07:45  has joined #xwiki 07:56  has quit 08:41  how are you doing guys :) 08:41  hey, hi! 08:42  :) 08:44  I'm the guy who came to thank you yesterday 08:44  well, I didn't log off apparently 08:44  bbiab 08:45  bbiab? 08:46  has joined #xwiki 08:46  is now known as 08:46  Hi men 08:47  hi there 08:51  has joined #xwiki 09:16  has quit 09:18  has quit 09:29  has joined #xwiki 09:36  has joined #xwiki 09:41  has joined #xwiki 09:43  checking platform ci build 10:02  has joined #xwiki 10:07  I've just realised that I can't log in into the Wiki, I belive it's something related to the rights problem 10:08  I can do it in basic authentication but not in the form one 10:10  tmortagne: several revapi breakages in http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/3217/console 10:11  don't know if they're related to your commits 10:11  for example: 10:11  java.method.exception.checkedAdded: method org.xwiki.extension.repository.result.IterableResult org.xwiki.platform.flavor.FlavorManager::getFlavors(org.xwiki.platform.flavor.FlavorQuery): Method newly throws checked exceptions: [org.xwiki.extension.repository.search.SearchException]. 10:11  Fixed it! 10:11  cool xwikiorg\_guest\_6 10:11  yes I know about this, I forgot to modify the pom 10:11  finishing something first 10:12  that was why platform is failing 10:12  ok 10:12  :)! 10:12  has joined #xwiki 10:22  has quit 10:25  by the way guys, today is my birthday! 10:40  Hi, I have a formatting question in xwiki syntax. Couldn't I do the markdown equivalent of ```my highligted text``` with a simple tag (other than (% class="code"%) (%%)  ?? 10:40  ie, without the "box" span 10:47  Sorry, I meant `my text is inline code` 10:50  vmassol, do you have an idea ? 10:51  xwikiorg\_guest\_6: happy birthday! As a present you get XWiki for free today, enjoy :) 10:51  martinus\_\_: no you can't 10:51  the closest is verbatim 10:51  or monospace 10:52  verbatim: {{{…}}} 10:52  monospace: ##...## 10:52  which you can then style using CSS 10:52  s/closest is verbatim/closest is monospace 10:52  yes, monospace 10:53  btw the markdown syntax uses the code macro 10:53  (under the hood) 10:54  vmassol, you mean html ? 10:54  ie http://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag\_code.asp 10:56  martinus\_\_: no 10:56  I meant the https://www.google.fr/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=1&ved=0ahUKEwjDqe2gwpPPAhWEPxoKHYgzDW4QFggeMAA&url=http%3A%2F%2Fextensions.xwiki.org%2Fxwiki%2Fbin%2Fview%2FExtension%2FCode%2BMacro&usg=AFQjCNGcQ6P0\_-LV4lFlvV7dnzZWMHAdTw&sig2=-MMPqJt6kk3l4soJUNY0JQ 10:56  oops 10:56  http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Code%20Macro 10:57  vmassol, the problem with code macro is it have the box around 10:58  that's also stylable with CSS 10:58  so you have several options 10:58  1) use ##…## and style it 10:59  2) use {{code}}…{{/code}} and style it 10:59  3) create a new wiki macro 11:00  I understand , I was just wondering with this doesn't come standard with xwiki syntax some kind of marker to display in line. Very simple. Like $$$my code$$$ 11:00  vmassol, thanks for helping 11:00  I don't understand 11:00  {{code}} macro does that 11:00  it has a box only when standalone 11:00  no? 11:00  (need to check) 11:01  http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/VMA/ 11:01  you have a link to what you'd like to have? 11:01  vmassol, I'm going to check on the playground to avoid custom css misleading  :) 11:02  because currently {{code}} does use " git init --bare" 11:02  on my wiki 11:03  vmassol, it's the case on playground too 11:03  ie this is a test 11:04  box+code 11:05  where I would like to have this is a test when used inline, and test when used standalone 11:06  (Am I splitting hairs ? :D ) 11:13  well I can't edit page on playground 11:13  Because I don't remember my username and the the http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/ForgotUsername is broken :D 11:16  checking 11:17  yes seems the user Guillaume Delhumeau has lost its script rights on playground 11:17  for some reason 11:17  and thus all the pages saved by him and that are using scripts are failing now 11:17  tmortagne is handling it 11:18  handling = bug Denis about it 11:20  ok I've fixed it 11:20  thanks vmassol 11:20  so to answer the "it has a box only when standalone", the answer is no, it always has the box as your example show 11:20  tmortagne: it's not the right fix but I've forced script rights for guillaume 11:20  on playground 11:20  so it's going to be reset tonight 11:21  vmassol: well Denis was trying to debug the issue 11:21  errr 11:21  broken again 11:22  please don't touch right, better resave the broken page with another author 11:22  I can't resave the 100 pages that use scripts :) 11:22  sorry again but how do I signup to this wiki ? 11:22 \* martinus\_\_ is hidding 11:23  actually there are"only" 32 not 100 ;) 11:23  but still a lot of owrk 11:24  tmortagne: I'll let you handle it then 11:24  well I don't want to bother with this right now btw 11:48  vmassol: I have repair it for now (by just resaving gdelhumeau profile) 12:02  Denis: ok thanks 12:06  has quit 12:40  has joined #xwiki 13:56  guys 13:56  is this new https://www.evernote.com/l/AHcm-lTZQPdEqoK-0EG5RujrBUAamGmXg8o ? Doesn't seem right and I don't recall this behavior 13:56  tmortagne: maybe you know? 13:58  actually there's another problem, it shows "recommended extensions" as the selected filter but shows all extensions 13:58  if I swtich to "all extensions" I don't the warning anymore 14:00  hmm seems it's also not working yet because when searched "forum" it said there was no recommended which isn't true 14:01  also tmortagne, when you're viewing the details of an extension or even the list of extensions the fact that they are recommended is not displayed. Do you have it in your plan for 8.3 to show that? 14:01  (would be nice) 14:38  has quit 14:40  has quit 14:46  has joined #xwiki 14:48  has quit 14:49  vmassol: I tough the message was explicit enough :) 14:49  when it does not find any recommended extension it shows all extensions 14:50  it "does work" because I did not patched xwiki.org yet 14:50  I wanted to write UI tests first 14:50  ok that explains a lot 14:50  xwiki.org does not send any information right now about recommended extensions 14:51  there's still one small issue but it won't be visible in practice 14:51  since there 'll always be at least one recommended extension 14:51  why ? 14:52  if no recommended extension match the search it won't have any 14:52  it's when you go in the app panel and click "install new app", if there are no recommended extensions it says something about searchig for "" but the user didn't search for anything 14:52  small usability issue 14:53  which won't be visible when we have recommended extensions returned 14:53  has joined #xwiki 14:53  sure but that's how this UI always worked, I just added recommended 14:53  sure it's just that we never see it 14:53  since there are always extensions 14:53  well if you don't disable extensions.xwiki.org 14:54  that's why I thought it was a new behavior 14:54  before I understood that it was listing recommended extensions 14:54  (and not finding any) 14:55  mflorea: found it 14:56  here: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/51a1427ed280b84a59ccf9c4a875f5282fbf01c7/xwiki-platform-tools/xwiki-platform-tool-packager-plugin/src/main/java/org/xwiki/tool/packager/PackageMojo.java#L481-L481 14:56  indeed, it should look at dependency management for the version 15:01  has joined #xwiki 15:09  has quit 15:13  has quit 15:24  has joined #xwiki 15:26  has quit 15:38  has quit 16:03  has joined #xwiki 16:07  has quit 16:20  has quit 16:27  has joined #xwiki 16:43  has quit 17:26  has joined #xwiki 17:44  has quit 18:10  has joined #xwiki 18:23  has quit 18:37  has quit 19:35  has quit 21:22  has quit 22:17  has quit {{/code}}
